title.rendered: Did salsa singer Willie Colón die on May 17?

content.rendered:
It’s false. The news of the alleged death of Willie Colón, world-renowned salsa singer, was spread through social networks. Panamanian lawyer and politician Guillermo Cochez was the first to spread the fake news in a post on his Twitter account. Later, more users also shared the false news, assuring that the salsa singer’s death occurred as a result of complications after the traffic accident he suffered on April 20.

However, minutes later El Heraldo published a note denying Colón’s death, according to information obtained from close friends of the singer. “People close to the famous musician of Puerto Rican origin assure that he remains in his house and is in clear recovery,” they published.

Blu Radio also denied the news. The media reported that he contacted Willie Colón’s manager, Carlos Prieto, who announced that the artist is still under medical care and that he is making progress in his recovery.

The true

On April 25, Willie Colón was admitted to a hospital in Virginia, United States, after suffering a traffic accident while traveling in a motorhome with his wife Julia. This according to a statement from his head of communication, Neil MacCarty.

Colón is in “serious but stable condition,” said the note, which detailed that the accident took place on April 20 when they were traveling through the Outer Banks region, in the state of North Carolina.

The couple had to be removed from the vehicle by the assistance teams. This is due to the state in which he was left after the accident and the artist was transferred to the Sentara Norfolk hospital.

His spokesman indicated that Colón suffered a head injury with concussion, cuts to the head for which he needed 16 stitches and fractures in his cervical C1, at the base of the skull.

In addition, he specified that they would soon make arrangements for his medical team at New York Presbyterian Hospital to treat him. Days later it became known about his transfer to the Big Apple. On her part, Julia Colón suffered cuts and bruises and was treated at an Outer Banks hospital, from where she had already been discharged.

On April 27, the salsero published on his Twitter account that he was not quite well, because the recovery would be long. He appreciated the messages from his fans.
